doc.title: Opal
doc.plot: The true story of Opal, a young woman who appears at The Atlantic Magazine office in 1920 Boston Declared a Prodigy, her childhood Diaries turn her into an overnight sensation and celebrity. Opal spent the last 53 years of her life in an English psychiatric hospital. Was she really suffering from a mentally deranged mind, or was her life that of a true Prodigy misunderstood?
